alarm.description: You open your eyes slowly. Your alarm is blaring. You have work at 9:00. You blink a few times, trying to clear the fog of sleep from your brain. The nightmares are still lingering. You should get up so you can eat breakfast, and then get to work. If you sleep too late you'll have to take the bus, which is always an unpleasant experience, but sleep is tugging on your brain...

alarmGoesOff.description: You open your eyes slowly. Your alarm is blaring. You have work at 9:00. You blink a few times, trying to clear the fog of sleep from your brain. The nightmares are still lingering. You should get up so you can eat breakfast, and then get to work. If you sleep too late you'll have to take the bus, which is always an unpleasant experience, but sleep is tugging on your brain...

getUp.title: Get Up
getUp.description: Get out of bed, shower, and get dressed.(30 minutes)

snooze.title: Snooze The Alarm
snooze.description: Snooze your alarm. It takes 50 minutes to walk to work, and 20 to ride the bus, given you don't run into any obstacles today. You should definitely eat breakfast before work today, you can feel your stomach growling... but if you could just sleep for a few more minutes maybe you'll feel a bit more rested... (15 minutes)

time.timeOut: You really need to get up, or you will miss work.

bedroom.description: Your bedroom. Though the warmth of your sheets is tempting, you should probably get ready for work.

hallway.click: A hallway to your kitchen and the exit.
hallway.description: You can go to your kitchen to get breakfast or leave for work.

kitchen.title: Go to the Kitchen
kitchen.description: Head to your kitchen and make sure you eat a good breakfast.

bus.title: Take the Bus to Work
bus.description: You hate taking the bus. It always stresses you out, but it's much faster, and you can't be late to work. (20 minutes)

walk.title: Walk to Work
walk.description: Walk to work. This is significantly less stressful than the bus, but takes much longer. (50 minutes)

hallway.click: A hallway to your living room and the exit.
hallway.description: Return to the living room, or leave your apartment.

livingroom.title: Return to the living room
livingroom.description: Go back to your living room

bus.title: Take the bus to work
bus.description: you hate taking the bus. It always stresses you out, but it is much faster, and you can't be late to work. (20 minutes)

walk.title: Walk to Work
walk.description: Walk to work. This is significantly less stressful than the bus, but takes much longer. (50 minutes)

fridge.click: Look in the fridge for something to eat.
fridge.description: You open up the fridge. You have a few options to choose from, and you know that eating well now will be a good start to your day.

small.title: Grab some fruit
small.description: Grab some fruit for breakfast. It's fast and easy, but you'll probably be hungry later.

medium.title: Make a sandwich
medium.description: Sit down for a peanut butter sandwich and toast. Maybe you'll have a glass of milk with that. (10 minutes)

large.title: Cook a nice breakfast
large.description: If you've got the time, why not make a big breakfast? Pancakes, eggs, maybe some bacon? You can feel your mouth watering already, and it will definitely leave you feeling great. (30 minutes)

busStop.description: The bus door wheezes as it opens. You hesitate as you enter. The bus is pretty full today. You spot an empty section a few rows down, but the likelyhood that someone will sit next to you is high.

toll.click: Go up to pay the toll
toll.description: You hesitate as you enter. The bus is pretty full today. You spot an empty section a few rows down, but the likelyhood that someone will sit next to you is high.

pay.title: Get on the Bus
pay.description: Pay the bus toll, and get on the crowded bus

wait.title: Wait for the Next Bus (10 minutes)
wait.description: Another bus comes in ten minutes, and it usually has less people on it. You could wait and avoid the crowd.

time.timeOut: You wish you could walk or wait for another bus, so that you could avoid the crowded mess that is this bus, but you can't afford to be late for work either.

walk.title: Walk to Work Instead
walk.description: You have the time, and you could avoid the crowds all together by walking to work.

panic.description: You panic. Your hands begin to sweat. The bus driver glances at you, an annoyed look on his face. "Well, are you getting on?" he grumbles at you. You nod quickly, and pay the toll before stumbling to you seat. you can feel yourself shaking.

didWait.description: You wait for the next bus. It takes 10 minutes for the bus to ride, then another 20 to get to work. The bus ride is uneventful.
